arts.ttl: Angus Gunn Scotland injury fear as Norwich keeper's dig in the ribs could open door for Craig Gordon return
arts.sum: Gordon could be set to start after Norwich boss Johannes Hoff Thorup couldn't confirm if Gunn would join up with the squad

arts.ttl: 'Everyone's stepped up' - Norwich fans react to Hull demolition
arts.sum: Watch Norwich City fans react to the Canaries' 4-0 Championship win over Hull City at Carrow Road.

arts.ttl: Hull City head coach Tim Walter fumes at two refereeing decisions after Norwich City hammering
arts.sum: Though City were well beaten at Carrow Road and saw Norwich Sargent slam a penalty against the post after Coyle's handball, Walter felt his side were well in the game. City were 3-0 down at Carrow Road but Pedro turned in from an Abu Kamara cross late in the game, a goal which the German felt may well have sparked a comeback in the final moments.

arts.ttl: Paddy's Pointers: Four observations after Norwich's cruise against Hull
arts.sum: Canaries football editor Paddy Davitt delivers his verdict from a 4-0 Championship hammering over Hull City.

arts.ttl: Hull City handed brutal Championship reality check as Norwich City run riot
arts.sum: Boss Walter made a double change from the win at QPR on Tuesday night with Oscar Zambrano and Marvin Mehlem both coming into the starting XI at the expense of Xavier Simons and Kasey Palmer, both of whom dropped to the subs bench where they were joined by the returning Charlie Hughes and a first appearance for new signing Joao Pedro. Hughes made an important early block to deny Ante Srnac and at the other end, City craved out two good openings with Slater slamming just wide, and then Belloumi, after he teased in a delightful delivery which had no takers, forced a save from Long.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings vs Norwich City as Mohamed Belloumi shines in heavy defeat
arts.sum: A flurry of openings came for City at the start of the second half, and though Josh Sargent slammed a penalty against a post, the Tigers should have got back into it before Kaide Gordon and Sainz made it three and four. Mohamed Belloumi: One of the few bright sparks in the first half for City, fashioned a good opening for himself but couldn't take it and then made one for Bedia who headed wide.

arts.ttl: Norwich hit Hull for four in impressive display
arts.sum: The visitors were no match for the home side.

arts.ttl: STARTING XIs: Norwich unchanged for Hull clash; Marcondes makes bench
arts.sum: Full team news and starting line-ups ahead of Norwich City's Championship meeting with Hull City at Carrow Road.
